pullRequest.title: allow customization of default Python interpreter used by reticulate
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR brings in the first bit of work for configuring the version of Python used by RStudio.
The Global Options pane now has a tab for Python, where Python-related settings can be configured (currently, this is just the default interpreter):

Clicking the Select... button brings up a dialog, listing all the Python interpreters that RStudio was able to discover on the system.

After the user has selected a version of Python they want to use,

The 'default Python interpreter' preference stored by RStudio is updated,
The RETICULATE_PYTHON environment variable is set, to match the RStudio preference.

Note that there is still a lot of work to consider; e.g.

A similar dialog for project-specific preferences;
Resolving conflicts between the RStudio-defined default Python preference, and any start-up scripts that might try to set RETICULATE_PYTHON,
The user should be prompted to restart R if they're changing the default version of Python but reticulate has already loaded Python in the session,

and so on. I plan to tackle these in separate PRs; I wanted to at least get the initial work into master now.

nodes.bodyText: Should use constant PYTHON_PLACEHOLDER_TEXT to ensure they match?

The listbox should have a label for screen readers (for a visual user it's obvious what it's for but it's an unlabeled control to a screen reader):
widgets_.setAriaLabel("Python Interpreters");
Noticed this file is indented with tabs instead of spaces.

This creates an unlabeled image (no alt text) so a screen reader will read the underlying filename which is a long guid-like identifier.
One option is to use DecorativeImage instead (which sets empty alt text), but since this icon communicates information, we should have a meaningful alt-text, instead, e.g. "Conda", "VirtualEnv", "Python".
Should this also check for python.exe on Windows?
